item.title: Form Thinking
item.description: The strangest homework assignment I received in college was to go outside after class and burrow into the ground. I did not complete that assignment. The next day my biology professor asked if any of us tried it. Nobody raised their hands. He then explained why. “That’s because you don’t have the right shape for burrowing! But a mole, with their small bodies, their paws and claws, they’re quite at home burrowing.

item.title: The Risk of Creativity
item.description: “Achilles realizes he’s not immortal. He grows up. We have a sickness of immortality. You can be whatever you want. It’s like playing tennis with the net down. If there are no rules, frankly, then there’s no sense of the tragic. There’s no sense of the limitations of the human. And without a sense of limitations, funny enough, people become miserable.” https://youtu.be/mFWxELAjbyY?t=788 “The consequence of abolishing cultural taboos is not liberty but anomie.
